snippet: Parishioners of a long-closed Roman Catholic church have lost their appeal of an order to end their 11-year vigil inside the building.
abstract: Massachusetts Appeals Court upholds ruling that parishioners occupying closed St Frances X Cabrini Church in Scituate, Mass, who have been holding vigil inside building since it was closed in 2004 as part of a reorganization, are trespassing on Archdiocese of Boston property and must vacate premises.
lead_paragraph: Parishioners of a long-closed Roman Catholic church have lost their appeal of an order to end their 11-year vigil inside the building.

headline.main: Massachusetts: Appeals Court Deals Defeat to 11-Year Vigil in Vacant Church
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts: Appeals Court Deals Defeat to 11-Year Vigil in Vacant Church
